lines.text: No, your mother... is not crazy. And neither, contrary to popular belief, is your brother crazy. He's merely miscast in a play. He was born in the wrong era, on the wrong side of the river... With the ability to be able to do anything that he wants to do and... findin' nothin' that he wants to do. I mean nothing.
I don't know why someone hasn't taken a rifle and blown your head off.
Even the most primitive of societies have an innate respect for the insane.
If you're going to lead people, you have to have somewhere to go.
California's like a beautiful, wild... beautiful, wild girl on heroin... who's high as a kite, thinkin' she's on top of the world, not knowing she's dying even if you show her the marks.

Every now and then, a person comes along, has a different view of the world than does the usual person. It doesn't make them crazy. I mean... an acute perception, man... that doesn't, that doesn't make you crazy.
Could you talk normal?
However sometimes... it can drive you crazy, acute perception.

Time is a funny thing. Time is a very peculiar item. You see when you're young, you're a kid, you got time, you got nothing but time. Throw away a couple of years, a couple of years there... it doesn't matter. You know. The older you get you say, "Jesus, how much I got? I got thirty-five summers left." Think about it. Thirty-five summers.
Are you ill, Russell-James?
I got cut up in a knife fight.
Yeah, really.
Yeah.
Yep, really.
[looking at both boys]
Strange lives you two lead.
Strange? At least I'm not a lawyer on welfare.
Hey, my brother's the coolest.
Well, you're better than cool. You're warm.
You think you'll understand him?
Yeah, but what I don't understand is why you hate him so much?
I hate him because you kids think he's an idol but he isn't. He is anything else but he is no hero!
Blind terror in a fight can easily pass for courage.
How do you know when someone's crazy?
Well, you don't always. It depends on how many people think they're crazy.

[Rusty James calling The Motorcycle Boy]
Hey bro, let's blow!
Hey, man. I really dig the colors!
[referring to the Siamese fighting fish]
The colors?
The colors are cool.
Uh-huh. Makes me kind of sorry I can't see the colors.
I never thought you were sorry about anything.
What's the big interest in the pet store all of a sudden?
They've been hanging around here.
Take a look at the fish.
You're crazy. You're really crazy. And, you know, I've known all about it all along.
But they belong in the river.
[guesturing at the fish]
I don't think they would fight if they were in the river. If they had room to live.
Someone ought to get you off the streets.
Somebody ought to put the fish in the river.
[starts chuckling to himself]

You know, if there were gangs around like in the old days, I'd be running things, not you. You'd be second lieutenant. You might have gotten by for a while on the Motorcycle Boy's rep, but you have to be smart to run things. You ain't got your brother's brains. It's nothing personal, Rusty James, but nobody would follow you into a fight because you'd get people killed - and nobody wants to be killed.
[first lines]
Biff Wilcox is looking for you, Rusty James. He's gonna kill you, Rusty James.
What's this? Another glorious battle for the kingdom?
Hey, man... I thought you were gone for good.
I thought we had a treaty.
You got any bread?
What?
[guesturing at the 2nd mugger]
He's not gonna bash us even if we got bread?
Sure, that's it.
Progressive country. Intergrated mugging.
I'm sooo tired of your jokes.
[he and Steve come across a wounded Rusty]
[quietly]
You gotta keep still.

[carefully begins to pick up Rusty]
You're gonna be okay. Don't move.
You pissed off at me, man?
[takes Rusty in his arms]
[whisper]
Don't talk. I'll take care of you.

[after realise that their rivals haven't arrived to the fight]
I guess we're gonna have to fight ourselves!
I saw that chick, Cassandra. She said she wasn't hooked.
Yeah? I believe her. You remember what happened to the people who didn't believe Cassandra?

[mumbling]
The Greeks got 'em.
What?

[more clearly]
The Greeks Got-'Em.
Man, what the fuck do the Greeks have to do with anything?
Once they get the dope off the streets, you know, people will persist in joining things. I mean, you'll see the gangs come back. If you live that long.
